New Records: Michael Busch hit his first big league multi-homer game
Key Match Events: Michael Busch had a go-ahead RBI single in the third
Pete Crow-Armstrong hit a two-run homer in the ninth
Tyson Miller struck out Brendan Rodgers and Ezequiel Tovar for his first career save
Pre-Game Insights: The Cubs were six games behind Atlanta and the New York Mets for the final NL wild card
Post-Match Reflections: Cubs manager Craig Counsell said 'We left a small farming village in central Illinois of runners on base, but we played good offense'
Rockies manager Bud Black said 'He told me during the game and after the game that his arm felt great'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Coors Field, which opened in 1995
Cal Quantrill gave up two runs, four hits and six walks in 2 1/3 innings
The Cubs went 3 for 14 with runners in scoring position and stranded 16 runners
Others: Michael Busch's first homer traveled 438 feet and the second a career-long 468 feet
